item.title: Democratic Upset in Deep Red Texas District Rattles Republicans
item.description: A Democrat won a state legislative special election in a district that President Trump carried by 17 percentage points, unnerving Republicans in Texas and beyond.
item.dc:creator: J. David Goodman

media:content.media:credit: Desiree Rios for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Taylor Rehmet, a Democratic candidate for the Texas Senate, in Fort Worth in January.

item.title: En Rusia, el desplome de los ingresos petroleros genera medidas económicas impopulares
item.description: La nueva realidad se cierne sobre las conversaciones de paz con Ucrania y ha obligado al Kremlin a subir los impuestos y aumentar la deuda.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Nechepurenko
item.category: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

media:content.media:credit: Alexey Malgavko/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A lo lejos, una refinería de petróleo y una central térmica en Omsk, Rusia, en 2023. La fuerte caída de los ingresos del petróleo ha enviado a Rusia a una nueva era de déficit presupuestario sostenido, impuestos más altos e inflación persistente.

item.title: My Patient Was Dying. His Wife Would Not Accept It.
item.description: How doctors can better navigate difficult patients and families.
item.dc:creator: Daniela J. Lamas

item.title: The Richest 2026 Players: A.I., Crypto, Pro-Israel Groups and Trump
item.description: All have amassed enormous war chests, new filings show, making them the financial wild cards of this year’s midterm elections and feared political spenders.
item.dc:creator: Theodore Schleifer

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: MAGA Inc., a super PAC run by President Trump’s aides, had more than $304 million on hand at the start of this year, thanks in part to donors eager to curry favor with the administration.

item.title: Why Is Taking the Rest of the Donetsk Region So Important to Putin?
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio called the question “the one remaining item” in Abu Dhabi peace talks. Russia disputed that.
item.dc:creator: Paul Sonne

media:content.media:credit: Tyler Hicks/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ukrainian soldiers in the Donetsk region of Ukraine, in December.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Big Hopes for Kennedy Airport’s Gigantic Makeover
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, February 1, 2026.

item.title: ‘I’m Free’: A Muslim Official Who Lost Faith in China Gains a Voice
item.description: Ma Ruilin worked as a Communist Party cadre helping fellow Muslims navigate their country as religious minorities, until the official hostility became too great to bear.
item.dc:creator: Li Yuan

media:content.media:credit: Owen Davies for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ma Ruilin praying in the basement of a halal restaurant where he works in Manhattan.

item.title: Years After Coup, Myanmar’s Government in Exile Teeters on Irrelevancy
item.description: The National Unity Government was formed as a pro-democracy alternative to the junta. But, critics say, it has failed to achieve most of its goals.
item.dc:creator: Sui-Lee Wee
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lining up to vote in the general election in Naypyidaw, Myanmar, in late December.

item.title: Corrections: Feb. 1, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Feb. 1, 2026.

item.title: Republican National Committee Enters 2026 With Nearly $100 Million Edge on D.N.C.
item.description: Democrats have struggled to raise money, as is often the case for the party out of power, but the depth of their financial hole against the Republican National Committee is noteworthy.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and Reid J. Epstein

media:content.media:credit: Annie Mulligan for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ken Martin was elected as the chairman of the Democratic National Committee in early 2025.

item.title: They Said They Weren’t Close to Epstein. New Documents Show Otherwise.
item.description: Materials released by the Justice Department revealed that leading business and political figures had enduring relationships with the disgraced financier.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Confessore

media:content.media:credit: Jon Elswick/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: The Justice Department released millions of pages of new documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Protesters Rally Across the U.S. in Solidarity With Minneapolis
item.description: Demonstrations drew sizable crowds in several cities, including Los Angeles and Portland, Ore., and churches in the Twin Cities rang their bells in support of detainees and protesters.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: About 100 people gathered to protest outside the B.H. Whipple Federal Building, where federal agents have been detaining suspected undocumented immigrants.

item.title: 10 Injured in 59-Vehicle Pileup on Fog-Shrouded California Highway, Police Say
item.description: One person died earlier this month in a foggy crash on the same highway.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

item.title: Mamdani Names Nonprofit Leader and Ex-Rikers Inmate to Run N.Y.C. Jails
item.description: Stanley Richards is taking over as correction commissioner at an inflection point for the city’s jails. Mayor Zohran Mamdani also named Dr. Alister Martin to lead the health department.
item.dc:creator: Maia Coleman and Hurubie Meko

media:content.media:credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Stanley Richards, right, and Mayor Zohran Mamdani earlier this month. Mr. Richards most recently served as the chief executive of the Fortune Society, a prisoner advocacy nonprofit.

item.title: Texas 18th District Special Runoff Election Results: Menefee vs Edwards
item.description: Get live results and maps from the Jan. 31, 2026 Texas special runoff elections.

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Read the document
item.description: A judicial order freeing a 5-year-old boy and his father, detained by federal immigration authorities.

item.title: Comical Mutation
item.description: Lance Enfinger and John Kugelman’s puzzle will transform you.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:credit: John Pratt/Keystone Features, via Hulton Archive, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Betty Driver, a British actress and singer, getting on top of the news with the help of her pet poodles.

item.title: T. Kumar, Rights Activist Who Was Shaped by Time in Prison, Dies at 76
item.description: After being jailed as a resistance organizer for the Tamil minority in his native Sri Lanka, he spoke out against governmental repression worldwide.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

item.title: Israel Launches Deadly Strikes in Gaza as Rafah Border Is Set to Reopen
item.description: The Israeli military launched a series of airstrikes on the Gaza Strip on Saturday. At least 26 people were killed in the attacks, according to the Gaza health ministry. The strikes came as Israel was expected to reopen the Rafah border between Gaza and Egypt.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Palestinians mourning their loved ones after Israeli airstrikes in Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: Facing Immigration Backlash, Trump Called Schumer to Cut a Deal
item.description: The president and the top Senate Democrat, who are often at each other’s throats, agreed to try to keep the government open and to start talks on new limits on federal immigration agents.
item.dc:creator: Carl Hulse

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Amid a backlash against ICE operations, President Trump worked out a rare compromise with Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, on spending legislation.

item.title: Laura Maioglio, Whose Restaurant Was a Theater District Mainstay, Dies at 93
item.description: Since 1962, she had overseen her father’s stately Italian restaurant, Barbetta, and became one of the city’s most enduring female restaurateurs.
item.dc:creator: Julie Besonen

media:content.media:credit: James Estrin/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Laura Maioglio in 1999. In 1996, the Italian government awarded Barbetta the Insegna del Ristorante Italiano, in recognition for serving the best authentic Italian food outside Italy.

item.title: Large Lizard Is Rescued After It’s Found Buried in Rhode Island Snow
item.description: The reptile, a tegu, had frostbite and showed signs of weakness from exposure in this week’s cold weather. It was unclear where it came from.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz

item.title: Explosions in Iran Spread Jitters and Rumors Amid Anticipation of Attacks
item.description: Deadly blasts, including one that may have been caused by a gas leak, raised anxiety in the country. “Society is waiting for war,” one Iranian said.
item.dc:creator: Leily Nikounazar and Pranav Baskar

media:content.media:credit: via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A video image posted on social media on Saturday showed the aftermath of an explosion at a building in Bandar Abbas, a port in southern Iran.

item.title: Judge Orders Release of 5-Year-Old Detained by Immigration Agents in Minnesota
item.description: The image of Liam Conejo Ramos, wearing a blue winter hat and Spider-Man backpack while in the custody of immigration agents, fueled outrage across the country.
item.dc:creator: Mattathias Schwartz and Emily Cochrane

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse, via Columbia Heights Public Schools
media:content.media:description: A federal judge ordered the release of a 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, a preschooler who was detained by ICE in Minneapolis, and his father from immigration custody.

item.title: ‘Melania’ Arrives With Strong Box Office Showing for a Documentary
item.description: Amazon backed up the Brink’s trucks to promote the vanity film, resulting in opening-weekend ticket sales of roughly $8 million, or 60 percent more than expected.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The first lady, Melania Trump, at a screening of “Melania” at the Kennedy Center in Washington D.C., on Thursday.

item.title: Winter Storm Hits the Carolinas, Bringing Dangerous Ice and Snow
item.description: Hundreds of crashes were reported on highways throughout the region, as freezing temperatures were predicted in the overnight hours.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Medina, Amy Graff, Kevin Maurer and Nick Madigan

media:content.media:credit: Alex Martin/Greenville News, via Imagn Images
media:content.media:description: A snowstorm touched every county of the Carolinas, including downtown Greenville, S.C., on Saturday.

item.title: Pentagon Defends Restrictions on Media Outlets
item.description: The purpose of the new rules is to “stop activity that could compromise national security,” the Defense Department said in response to a New York Times lawsuit.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wemple

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Pentagon imposed restrictions on media organizations in October, calling them a reasonable initiative to balance national security with media access.

item.title: New Epstein Files Name Elon Musk, Bill Gates and Other Powerful Men
item.description: Elon Musk, Richard Branson and Sergey Brin were among those who exchanged messages or visited with Jeffrey Epstein, according to the newly released documents.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump was mentioned in more than a dozen tips received by the Federal Bureau of Investigation in connection with Jeffrey Epstein, but the released files contained no corroborating evidence.

item.title: Danes Who Fought Alongside US Troops March Against Trump’s Comments
item.description: In the latest anti-American gathering in Denmark, veterans who went to war alongside U.S. troops took to the streets of Copenhagen.
item.dc:creator: Maya Tekeli and Lynsey Chutel
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Emil Helms/Ritzau Scanpix Foto, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Danish military veterans and their families marching in Copenhagen on Saturday in protest of recent comments by President Trump.

item.title: Chicago Orders Police to Document Potentially Illegal Federal Immigration Tactics
item.description: The order, signed by Mayor Brandon Johnson, instructs police officers to report allegations of unlawful conduct in an effort to prosecute the most aggressive federal immigration actions.
item.dc:creator: Emily Cochrane

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A federal agent kicking a tear-gas canister toward a group of people in Chicago in October.

item.title: Premios Grammy: Bad Bunny podría hacer historia
item.description: Kendrick Lamar es el artista con más nominaciones el domingo, seguido de Lady Gaga. Pero en la industria de la música y más allá, Bad Bunny es el centro de atención.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sisario

media:content.media:credit: Chris Pizzello/Invision, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny is the first Spanish-language artist to be nominated for album, song and record of the year all at once.

item.title: Demond Wilson, Long-Suffering Son on ‘Sanford and Son,’ Dies at 79
item.description: As Lamont, he was a young man in constant battle with his father and business partner, played by Redd Foxx, on the popular 1970s series.
item.dc:creator: Anita Gates

media:content.media:credit: NBCU Photo Bank, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Mr. Wilson, left, in 1972 on “Sanford and Son” with Redd Foxx, who played his character’s father.

item.title: Trump Has Only One Tool in His Toolbox
item.description: The president’s brute-force approach to power is wearing thin.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie

media:content.media:credit: Stephen Maturen/Getty Images

item.title: Federal Judge Denies Request to Block ICE Surge in Minnesota
item.description: Minnesota officials had sought a temporary end to the deployment of 3,000 federal agents, claiming state sovereignty had been violated.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:credit: David Guttenfelder/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The lawsuit sought to halt the aggressive tactics of immigration agents in Minneapolis-St.Paul.

item.title: Alex Pretti Memorial Grows, a Week After He Was Killed
item.description: One week after the I.C.U. nurse was shot dead by federal agents, tributes continue to build on the sidewalk where he fell.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: There are flowers, candles and words upon words at the scene of the killing.

item.title: Bovino Is Said to Have Mocked Prosecutor’s Jewish Faith on Call With Lawyers
item.description: Gregory Bovino, the Border Patrol field leader, made disparaging remarks in reference to the U.S. attorney in Minnesota, an Orthodox Jew, people with knowledge of the phone call said.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño and Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:credit: Vincent Alban/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gregory Bovino at a news conference in Minneapolis earlier this month.

item.title: Easy Protein Granola Recipe With Peanut Butter
item.description: Egg whites, peanuts and hemp seeds add an extra protein boost to these crunchy, snacky clusters.
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Armando Rafael for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Cyd Raftus McDowell.
media:content.media:description: Yossy Arefi’s peanut butter protein granola.

item.title: Overlooked No More: Jimmy Reed, the Bluesman Everyone Covered, Then Forgot
item.description: His most enduring hits were recorded by Elvis Presley, Aretha Franklin, the Rolling Stones and the Grateful Dead. But his own career faded from view.
item.dc:creator: Bill Friskics-Warren

media:content.media:credit: Jan Persson/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Jimmy Reed performing in 1968. He built a bridge between rock and the blues, placing 12 singles on the pop chart as well as 18 in the R&B Top 20.

item.title: When the Doctor Needs a Checkup
item.description: The physician work force is aging fast, and some hospitals now require that older clinicians undergo testing for cognitive decline. Many have resisted.
item.dc:creator: Paula Span

media:content.media:credit: Eugenia Mello

item.title: Cómo liberarte de la culpa
item.description: Esta emoción puede impulsarte a hacer lo correcto, pero también hundirte.
item.dc:creator: Jancee Dunn

item.title: My Favorite Dessert in New York City, Now on Demand
item.description: The silky chocolate mousse from Penny is utter bliss on a plate. I adapted the recipe so you can have it no matter where you are.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Linda Xiao for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Rebecca Jurkevich.
media:content.media:description: Penny’s Chocolate Mousse by Joshua Pinsky, adapted by Vaughn Vreeland.

item.title: Morris Waxler, F.D.A. Official Who Switched Stance on Lasik, Dies at 88
item.description: While at the federal agency, he approved the laser device for eye surgery but later warned of its potential to cause harm.
item.dc:creator: Sam Roberts

item.title: Minneapolis Residents Wear Their Passports, Desperate to Ward Off ICE
item.description: ICE agents can stop anyone they suspect of being undocumented. Now, residents are weighing their rights and their pride against their own safety.
item.dc:creator: Talya Minsberg and Lauren McCarthy

media:content.media:credit: Liam James Doyle for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: María Pabón Gautier’s children wear their identities around their necks.

item.title: Solutions for the Crisis in Classical Music
item.description: Readers discuss ways to rescue the industry.

item.title: The Trad Life Fantasy Was Never Real
item.description: Stories from the past and present suggest that families have always needed a social safety net.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Grose

item.title: Pierre Poilievre Is Retained as Leader of Canada’s Conservatives
item.description: Pierre Poilievre, a populist who led the Conservative Party to defeat last year, was retained as its leader on Friday, despite his dismal poll numbers.
item.dc:creator: Norimitsu Onishi

media:content.media:credit: Jennifer Gauthier/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Members of Canada’s Conservative Party voted overwhelmingly on Friday to keep Pierre Poilievre as their leader at a party convention in Calgary, Alberta.

item.title: Israel Launches Attack in Gaza
item.description: A local health official said at least 26 people had been killed in the attacks, which the Israeli military said had targeted Hamas commanders.
item.dc:creator: Natan Odenheimer and Fatima AbdulKarim

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Palestinians mourning their loved ones after Israeli airstrikes in Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: The Latest Way to Create an Isolated Retreat: Buy a Whole Village
item.description: Wealthy buyers and tourism entrepreneurs are acquiring abandoned European villages — school, church and bar included.
item.dc:creator: Brent Crane

item.description: Melania’s movie, not exactly boffo box office.

item.title: Pay More Attention to A.I.
item.description: A new world, hard to grasp and even harder to predict.
